Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Manage edit documentation " (#8169) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Summary of the changes (in less than 80 characters):

Documentation UI change  in manage package page:

* Hide the edit documentation session if the package has embedded readme file 
![docudisable](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64443925/90832849-92748580-e2fb-11ea-941c-dc435cdb9d52.PNG)

* Show the edit documentation session if package without embedeed readme file 


Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3307

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Move to Knockout 3.5.1 and fix admin JS errors" (#8168) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We have unused Knockout NuGet dependencies. We do not pull in Knockout in this way. They are just files checked in to source control.

The admin errors are because `error` is no longer the syntax for jQuery AJAX errors. It is `fail`. This was likely from the jQuery update we did a while back but went undetected.

Address https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3311

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Advanced search] Update search KPIs" (#8085) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
# Work

* [x] Update OneNote. [LINK](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/_layouts/OneNote.aspx?id=%2Fteams%2FNuGet%2FTeam%2FNugetServer%2FNugetServerTeamNote&wd=target%28Operations.one%7CC674B49C-4CB7-4793-8890-A1E46E33FEB9%2FEvaluating%20advanced%20search%7CABC8D401-9DA2-4CEA-B1AC-55E46C346CAC%2F%29onenote:https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/Team/NugetServer/NugetServerTeamNote/Operations.one#Evaluating%20advanced%20search&section-id={C674B49C-4CB7-4793-8890-A1E46E33FEB9}&page-id={ABC8D401-9DA2-4CEA-B1AC-55E46C346CAC}&end)
* [x] Review updated KPIs
* [X] Update Application Insights saved queries
    * [ ] ~~DEV~~
    * [ ] ~~INT~~
    * [x] PROD

# Updated search KPIs

For the section below there are three categories of KPIs:

* The "Original KPIs" are the current Shared Queries in the **nuget-prod-v2gallery** Application Insights account that will replaced.
* The "Updated KPIs" will replace the existing Shared Queries in the **nuget-prod-v2gallery**  Application Insights account.
* The "Additional advanced search KPIs" are ad-hoc queries for further analysis. These will not be saved to App Insights account, but they are listed in the ["Evaluationg advanced search" Operations OneNote](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/_layouts/OneNote.aspx?id=%2Fteams%2FNuGet%2FTeam%2FNugetServer%2FNugetServerTeamNote&wd=target%28Operations.one%7CC674B49C-4CB7-4793-8890-A1E46E33FEB9%2FEvaluating%20advanced%20search%7CABC8D401-9DA2-4CEA-B1AC-55E46C346CAC%2F%29onenote:https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/Team/NugetServer/NugetServerTeamNote/Operations.one#Evaluating%20advanced%20search&section-id={C674B49C-4CB7-4793-8890-A1E46E33FEB9}&page-id={ABC8D401-9DA2-4CEA-B1AC-55E46C346CAC}&end).

## Sessions that use advanced search

<details>
<summary>Additional advanced search KPIs...</summary>

This is an ad-hoc query used to analyze usage

```
// Usage of regular vs advanced search in past 7 days
customMetrics 
| where timestamp > ago(7d)
| where name == "BrowserSearchPage" 
| extend hasPackageType = isnotempty(customDimensions.PackageType) 
| extend hasSortBy = (isnotempty(customDimensions.SortBy) and customDimensions.SortBy !~ "relevance") 
| extend isAdvancedSearch = (hasPackageType or hasSortBy) 
| summarize
    timestamp = min(timestamp),
    Kind = iff(countif(isAdvancedSearch) > 0, "Advanced search", "Regular search")
    by session_Id
| summarize count() by bin(timestamp, 1d), Kind
| render columnchart kind=stacked
```
</details>

## Avg. click index on first page

<details>
<summary>Original KPI...</summary>

```
// Avg. click index on first page
let minTimestamp = todatetime('2019-11-14T21:00:00Z');
let maxTimestamp = todatetime('2019-11-30T00:00:00Z');
customMetrics
| where timestamp > minTimestamp 
| where timestamp < maxTimestamp
| where name == "BrowserSearchSelection"
| extend clickIndex = toint(customDimensions.ClickIndex)
| where clickIndex <= 19
| extend isPreviewSearch = customDimensions.IsPreviewSearch == "True"
| summarize avg(clickIndex) by isPreviewSearch
| order by isPreviewSearch
```
</details>

<details>
<summary>Updated KPI...</summary>

```
// Avg. click index on first page (EXCLUDES advanced search)
let minTimestamp = todatetime('2019-11-14T21:00:00Z');
let maxTimestamp = todatetime('2019-11-30T00:00:00Z');
customMetrics
| where timestamp > minTimestamp 
| where timestamp < maxTimestamp
| where name == "BrowserSearchSelection"
| extend clickIndex = toint(customDimensions.ClickIndex)
| where clickIndex <= 19
| extend hasPackageType = isnotempty(customDimensions.PackageType)
| extend hasSortBy = (isnotempty(customDimensions.SortBy) and customDimensions.SortBy !~ "relevance")
| extend isAdvancedSearch = (hasPackageType or hasSortBy)
| where not(isAdvancedSearch)
| extend isPreviewSearch = customDimensions.IsPreviewSearch == "True"
| summarize avg(clickIndex) by isPreviewSearch
| order by isPreviewSearch
```
</details>

<details>
<summary>Additional advanced search KPIs...</summary>

```
// Avg. click index on first page (INCLUDES advanced search)
let minTimestamp = todatetime('2019-11-14T21:00:00Z');
let maxTimestamp = todatetime('2019-11-30T00:00:00Z');
customMetrics
| where timestamp > minTimestamp 
| where timestamp < maxTimestamp
| where name == "BrowserSearchSelection"
| extend clickIndex = toint(customDimensions.ClickIndex)
| where clickIndex <= 19
| extend isPreviewSearch = customDimensions.IsPreviewSearch == "True"
| summarize avg(clickIndex) by isPreviewSearch
| order by isPreviewSearch

// Avg. click index on first page (SEPARATES advanced search)
let minTimestamp = todatetime('2020-08-01T00:00:00Z');
let maxTimestamp = todatetime('2020-08-17T00:00:00Z');
customMetrics
| where timestamp > minTimestamp 
| where timestamp < maxTimestamp
| where name == "BrowserSearchSelection"
| extend clickIndex = toint(customDimensions.ClickIndex)
| where clickIndex <= 19
| extend hasPackageType = isnotempty(customDimensions.PackageType)
| extend hasSortBy = (isnotempty(customDimensions.SortBy) and customDimensions.SortBy !~ "relevance")
| extend isAdvancedSearch = (hasPackageType or hasSortBy)
| extend isPreviewSearch = customDimensions.IsPreviewSearch == "True"
| summarize avg(clickIndex) by isPreviewSearch, isAdvancedSearch
| order by isPreviewSearch, isAdvancedSearch
```
</details>

## Clicks on first page %

<details>
<summary>Original KPI...</summary>

```
// Clicks on first page %
let minTimestamp = todatetime('2019-11-14T21:00:00Z');
let maxTimestamp = todatetime('2019-11-30T00:00:00Z');
customMetrics
| where timestamp > minTimestamp 
| where timestamp < maxTimestamp
| where name == "BrowserSearchSelection"
| extend clickIndex = toint(customDimensions.ClickIndex)
| extend isPreviewSearch = customDimensions.IsPreviewSearch == "True"
| summarize 100.0 * countif(clickIndex <= 19) / count() by isPreviewSearch
| order by isPreviewSearch 
```
</details>

<details>
<summary>Updated  KPI...</summary>

```
// Clicks on first page % (EXCLUDES advanced search)
let minTimestamp = todatetime('2019-11-14T21:00:00Z');
let maxTimestamp = todatetime('2019-11-30T00:00:00Z');
customMetrics
| where timestamp > minTimestamp 
| where timestamp < maxTimestamp
| where name == "BrowserSearchSelection"
| extend clickIndex = toint(customDimensions.ClickIndex)
| extend isPreviewSearch = customDimensions.IsPreviewSearch == "True"
| extend hasPackageType = isnotempty(customDimensions.PackageType)
| extend hasSortBy = (isnotempty(customDimensions.SortBy) and customDimensions.SortBy !~ "relevance")
| extend isAdvancedSearch = (hasPackageType or hasSortBy)
| where not(isAdvancedSearch)
| summarize 100.0 * countif(clickIndex <= 19) / count() by isPreviewSearch
| order by isPreviewSearch 
```
</details>

<details>
<summary>Additional advanced search KPIs...</summary>

```
// Clicks on first page % (SEPARATES advanced search)
let minTimestamp = todatetime('2020-08-01T00:00:00Z');
let maxTimestamp = todatetime('2020-08-17T00:00:00Z');
customMetrics
| where timestamp > minTimestamp 
| where timestamp < maxTimestamp
| where name == "BrowserSearchSelection"
| extend clickIndex = toint(customDimensions.ClickIndex)
| extend isPreviewSearch = customDimensions.IsPreviewSearch == "True"
| extend hasPackageType = isnotempty(customDimensions.PackageType)
| extend hasSortBy = (isnotempty(customDimensions.SortBy) and customDimensions.SortBy !~ "relevance")
| extend isAdvancedSearch = (hasPackageType or hasSortBy)
| summarize 100.0 * countif(clickIndex <= 19) / count() by isPreviewSearch, isAdvancedSearch
| order by isPreviewSearch 

// Clicks on first page % (INCLUDES advanced search)
let minTimestamp = todatetime('2020-08-01T00:00:00Z');
let maxTimestamp = todatetime('2020-08-17T00:00:00Z');
customMetrics
| where timestamp > minTimestamp 
| where timestamp < maxTimestamp
| where name == "BrowserSearchSelection"
| extend clickIndex = toint(customDimensions.ClickIndex)
| extend isPreviewSearch = customDimensions.IsPreviewSearch == "True"
| summarize 100.0 * countif(clickIndex <= 19) / count() by isPreviewSearch
| order by isPreviewSearch
```
</details>

## Bounce %

This KPI is unchanged.

<details>
<summary>Original KPI...</summary>

```
// Bounce %
let minTimestamp = todatetime('2019-11-14T21:00:00Z');
let maxTimestamp = todatetime('2019-11-30T00:00:00Z');
customMetrics
| where timestamp > minTimestamp
| where timestamp < maxTimestamp
| where session_Id != ""
| where name == "BrowserSearchPage"
| extend searchTerm = tostring(customDimensions.SearchTerm)
| where searchTerm != ""
| extend isPreviewSearch = customDimensions.IsPreviewSearch == "True"
| project session_Id, searchTerm, isPreviewSearch
| join kind=leftanti (
¬†¬†¬†¬†customMetrics
¬†¬†¬†¬†| where timestamp > minTimestamp
| where timestamp < maxTimestamp
¬†¬†¬†¬†| where session_Id != ""
¬†¬†¬†¬†| where name == "BrowserSearchSelection"
¬†¬†¬†¬†| extend searchTerm = tostring(customDimensions.SearchTerm)
| where searchTerm != ""
¬†¬†¬†¬†| project session_Id, searchTerm
) on $left.session_Id == $right.session_Id and $left.searchTerm == $right.searchTerm
| summarize bounceCount = count() by isPreviewSearch
| join (
¬†¬†¬†¬†customMetrics
¬†¬†¬†¬†| where timestamp > minTimestamp
¬†¬†¬†¬†| where timestamp < maxTimestamp
¬†¬†¬†¬†| where session_Id != ""
¬†¬†¬†¬†| where name == "BrowserSearchPage"
¬†¬†¬†¬†| extend isPreviewSearch = customDimensions.IsPreviewSearch == "True"
¬†¬†¬†¬†| summarize totalCount = count() by isPreviewSearch
) on $left.isPreviewSearch == $right.isPreviewSearch
| project isPreviewSearch,
bounceCount,
totalCount,
bouncePercentage = 100.0 * bounceCount / totalCount
| order by isPreviewSearch
```
</details>

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Add an entry for (soon to be stable) scripting usages" (#8167) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Summary of the changes (in less than 80 characters):

* F# 5.0 (which will release with .Net 5) and the dotnet/interactive project allow for using a variation of the `#r` syntax for including DLLs explicitly to also include packages.  This syntax is of the form:

```
#r "nuget: <package name>[, <list of options>*]"
```

where `<list of options>` is primarily used for specifying the `Version` of the package (which defaults to '*').

In the interests of making it easier for users to use nuget package in scripting/interactive/notebook scenarios, I think there's value in showing that syntax on Nuget.org.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "URL with non-existing version number returns latest package version" (#4624) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Try going to https://www.nuget.org/packages/Newtonsoft.Json/1337.42.42.0 (or ending with any other valid version number).

It returns back a 200 response with the information of the latest package, as if you've gone to https://www.nuget.org/packages/Newtonsoft.Json.

I'd expect this to return a 404 üòÑ

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "net5.0 VS APIs" (#9650) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Because of the addition of a platform component to .NET tfms since 5.0 (https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3339), any APIs relying on `FrameworkName` have become mostly incompatible with net5.0.

In particular, the VsFrameworkCompatibility APIs rely on these objects. We need to come up with guidance for customers who can't use the extensibility framework APIs to work around this.

We also need to figure out the impact of this change on folks who might be using this.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "MSBuild project evaluation fails when TargetFramework property includes semicolon" (#9927) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The .NET SDK is now using `NuGetFramework` methods to parse the `TargetFramework` property, via MSBuild intrinsic functions that were added for this:

https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/blob/5b50ac24ecd5af91736cf81360eab5813c9e93b9/src/Tasks/Microsoft.NET.Build.Tasks/targets/Microsoft.NET.TargetFrameworkInference.targets#L54-L55

However, this is causing MSBuild evaluation to fail with an assertion when the `TargetFramework` property has a semicolon in it (for example `netcoreapp2.0;net461`).  What is supposed to happen is for the SDK to generate an error during the build:

> error NETSDK1046: The TargetFramework value 'netcoreapp2.0;net461' is not valid. To multi-target, use the 'TargetFrameworks' property instead.

However, instead evaluation fails with the following:

> ---- DEBUG ASSERTION FAILED ----
---- Assert Short Message ----
invalid folder name, this appears to contain multiple frameworks
---- Assert Long Message ----
>
>   at NuGet.Frameworks.NuGetFramework.Parse(String folderName, IFrameworkNameProvider mappings)
   at NuGet.Frameworks.NuGetFramework.Parse(String folderName)
   at System.RuntimeMethodHandle.InvokeMethod(Object target, Object[] arguments, Signature sig, Boolean constructor, Boolean wrapExceptions)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeMethodInfo.Invoke(Object obj, BindingFlags invokeAttr, Binder binder, Object[] parameters, CultureInfo culture)
   at System.Reflection.MethodBase.Invoke(Object obj, Object[] parameters)
   at Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.NuGetFrameworkWrapper.Parse(String tfm) in C:\git\msbuild\src\Build\Utilities\NuGetFrameworkWrapper.cs:line 55
   at Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.NuGetFrameworkWrapper.GetTargetFrameworkIdentifier(String tfm) in C:\git\msbuild\src\Build\Utilities\NuGetFrameworkWrapper.cs:line 60
   at Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.IntrinsicFunctions.GetTargetFrameworkIdentifier(String tfm) in C:\git\msbuild\src\Build\Evaluation\IntrinsicFunctions.cs:line 486

I think to fix this the parse methods should return "Unsupported" instead of asserting when there is a semicolon in the value passed in.

I ran into this when testing private NuGet packages based on this PR: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3578.  As our tests didn't fail previously, this may have been a regression in that PR.

@nkolev92

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PackageManager.InstallPackageAsync() throws NullReferenceException" (#9926) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Owner Tag not shipped in nuspec file using dotnet pack" (#9925) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
---
**Issue moved from dotnet/sdk#12538**
- Please respond to @kmuthukumar23.

---

_From @kmuthukumar23 on Friday, July 17, 2020 4:26:19 AM_

### Describe the bug

Run the '**dotnet pack pathTo csproj**' in CLI, the owner tag is missing in nuspec file with in the generated nuget. I have faced this issue recent days. Before 10days it was working fine. last three days i am facing this issue.

### To Reproduce

I am using this below tags in my project file.

<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk.Razor">

      <PropertyGroup>

      <Title>projectTitle</Title>

      <Company>MyName</Company>

     <Authors>MyName</Authors>

     </PropertyGroup>

     </Project>

Expected Nupec contents

<metadata>

    <title>projectTitle</title>

    <authors>MyName</authors>

     <owners>MyName</owners>

</metadata>

But it generated with out '<owners></owners>' tag

<metadata>

    <title>projectTitle</title>

    <authors>MyName</authors>

</metadata>

It occurs recent days only.

### Further technical details
- ASP.NET Core version - 3.1

- Include the output of `dotnet --info`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Test Failure] No-op restore doesn‚Äôt occur at the first time in MSBuild restore command for the non-.Net SDK-style projects" (#9924) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.8.0.6779
VS Version: Master\30418.48
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps
1. Create a non-.Net SDK-style project [e.g. C# Console App (.NET Framework)] in VS.
2. Open the PM UI of the project and install several packages with ‚ÄúPackageReference‚Äù format.
3. Save the solution and close VS.
4. Go to the VS developer command prompt, cd to the path of the project and do ‚Äúmsbuild /t:restore /v:d‚Äù.
## Expected Result
No-op restore occur for the first time.
## Actual Result
No-op restore doesn‚Äôt occur at the first time. It start to occur from the second time as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/90614395-321f0e80-e23d-11ea-95be-bb4fc721f963.png)
## Notes
1. It doesn‚Äôt repro in VS build restore for the same project (as below screenshot).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/90614442-3f3bfd80-e23d-11ea-9f51-6c792da9d94b.png)
2. It started to repro from Dev\5.8.0.6761 (didn‚Äôt repro on Dev\5.8.0.6760).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Display the resolved version in the PMUI." (#9826) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: In the current behavior when using floating version we are not displaying the correct installed version and we are getting this version from the PackageReference instead of the assets file.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "error : The local source '/home/gysun/myNuGetServer' doesn't exist." (#9922) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet Version: 5.5.0.6382
.NET Core SDK (3.0.101)
OS version (ubuntu-16.04):

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
1. nuget sources Add -Name "MyServer" -Source /home/gysun/myNugetServer
2. nuget add new_package.1.0.0.nupkg -source /home/gysun/myNugetServer
3. git clone https://github.com/dotnet/corefx.git ;cd corefx
4. vim NuGet.config and add 
           <add key="MyServer" value="/home/gysun/myNuGetServer" /> 
5. then run 
          ./build.sh --configuration Debug --arch arm64 /p:DisableCrossgen=true /p:PortableBuild=true /p:SkipTests=true
    then error is :
      /corefx/.dotnet/sdk/3.0.100/NuGet.targets(123,5): error : The local source '/home/gysun/myNuGetServer' doesn't exist. [/corefx/external/runtime/runtime.depproj]


so , I don`t know to add a local souce to NuGet.config. I want get a help ,thank you very much!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Automating our GitHub processes" (#9923) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: This is a tracking epic for various tasks we'll be doing to automate our development process on GitHub, mostly through writing bots and scripts.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PackageManagerUI should abstract use of PackageReference for VS.Oe scenarios" (#9907) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: PM UI needs to abstract the use of PackageReference to better support serializability for online scenarios.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet Target framework information breaking change coordination" (#9911) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
In 16.8 P2, NuGet made a breaking change where we started reading the TargetFramework* and TargetPlatform* properties from the inner build.
This means that the framework detection across NuGet & SDK needed to change. 

In additional .NET 5 SDK, P7 and earlier, misreported the TargetPlatformMoniker for net5.0 projects as `Windows,Version=7.0`. 

Other notable challenges are that in 16.8 P2, NuGet used TargetPlatformIdentifier and TargetPLatformVersion, but in 16.8 P3 NuGet will use TargetPlatformMoniker. https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3578. 

So this is meant to coordinate the insertions necessary to get 16.8 P2 and 16.8 P3 in a happy state. 

- [x] NuGet -> VS (16.8 P2) [PR](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_git/VS/pullrequest/267136) (done)
- [x] NuGet -> SDK (.NET 5 P8 & .NET 5 RC1)
  - @sfoslund in charge https://github.com/NuGet/Client.Engineering/issues/462, https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/12915 and https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/12897 (the main tracking issue)
  - Approved by tactics!
  - Merged into preview.8 (not master, yet?)
- [x] NuGet -> project-system (16.8 P2) https://github.com/dotnet/project-system/pull/6495 - This allows NuGet in VS 16.8 P2 and 16.8 P3 to work continuously.
- [x] Further insertion blocked (Charles and Peter)
  - https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_git/VS/pullrequest/267767?_a=overview
  - https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_git/VS/pullrequest/268099?_a=files
- [x] Insertions pending SDK changes
  - https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/12944
  - https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/12943
  - Estimated to land the night of 2020/08/17 (Monday), possibly early Tuesday
  - Once these are merged, insertion can be attempted again (and those will take a while to do their runs)
  - Matt will make sure drop gets pulled
- [x] SDK -> VS (.NET 5 P8 with NuGet to VS 16.8 P2)
  - @wli3 will be taking point on this
  - He will target https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_git/VS?version=GBdev%2Fvslsnap%2Finsertions%2Fmaster.20200814130317 instead of 16.8 or master (because project system changes need SDK changes to pass DDRITS and vice versa)
  - SDK has flowed into the installer branch: https://dnceng.visualstudio.com/internal/_build/results?buildId=772035&view=results
- [x] project-system -> VS (16.8 P2) (See email thread for status, JJ and microbuild are on this. Tracking issue for insertion: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_git/VS/pullrequest/268099 )
  - master got locked, so PR 267767 had to be redirected to main

cc @zkat

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Move ToolWindow creation to AsyncPackage APIs" (#9570) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Calls to uiShell.CreateToolWindow (in Nuget Codespaces) should be replaced with their appropriate counterparts in AsyncPackage, documented here: [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.visualstudio.shell.asyncpackage?view=visualstudiosdk-2019](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.visualstudio.shell.asyncpackage?view=visualstudiosdk-2019)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CVE-2020-1340 - NuGet Gallery Spoofing Vulnerability" (#45) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
A spoofing vulnerability exists when the NuGet Gallery does not properly sanitize input on package metadata values. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could perform cross-site scripting attacks and run scripts in the security context of the user viewing the malicious content.

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker with permissions to upload packages could publish specially crafted content on a gallery page.

The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how NuGet Gallery sanitizes input.

**MSRC Security Guidance:** [CVE-2020-1340](https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1340)
**Security Update:** [v2020.06.09](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/releases/tag/v2020.06.09)
